result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin James Patzer

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant Justin James Patzer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Justin James Patzer.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF221 and 22CT101. Attorney Hoffman notes that the matter will need to be set for argued sentencing. Asks for plea date. State notes that there is an offer with a cap, defendant will plead to burglary charge and State will cap recommendation at 3 years of ES and 3 years IC. Both parties note that PSI will not be requested. Court asks for print out of prior criminal history.  Court sets matter for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Justin James Patzer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Justin James Patzer.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf for Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman makes argument for lower cash bail to be set. States has family local. Defendant has one fta in WI and one fta in MN. State is opposed to bail reduction and finds amount ordered appropriate. State reviews defendant's criminal history out of WI and MN. Defendant is on probation in Wisconsin. Defendant makes statement regarding Minnesota charges. Court reviews charges and defendant's criminal history. Court denies bail modification.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification

11:16 AM Defendant Justin James Patzer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Justin James Patzer.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman notes defendant has revocation matter pending and asks for status in 3-4 weeks. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:12 AM Defendant Justin James Patzer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Justin James Patzer.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State refers to Attorney Hoffman on status. Attorney Hoffman notes unresolved and asks for another status. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:09 AM Defendant Justin James Patzer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Justin James Patzer.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF221 and 22CT101. State indicates that the defendant has made offer, State will be extending counter offer. Asks for another status.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:01 AM Defendant Justin James Patzer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Justin James Patzer.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney acknowledges receipt, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

8:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin James Patzer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Justin James Patzer. 
Att Hoffman- Client will waive prelim
Court finds probable cause, defendant bound over for arraignment, sets date
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim 1, Joseph Polechek, no return to 1416 N 1st St or 1925 Lackawana Ave.

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin James Patzer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Justin James Patzer. Defendant verifies address. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $500 cash bail. No contact with Victim 1, Joseph Polechek, no return to 1416 N 1st St or 1925 Lackawana Ave. State recites defendant previous criminal history and FTAs. Defendant is currently on probation with 2 years prison time imposed and stayed; probation is looking to revoke in that file. Asks that preliminary hearing is set out  past June 22. Attorney Hoffman does not object given the defendant's probation hold. Court orders $2,000 cash. No contact with Victim 1, Joseph Polechek, 1416 N 1st St or 1925 Lackawana Ave. Defendant indicates that he wants preliminary hearing set as soon as possible.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
